primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Son of God enters the world to take away the sin of the world through a singular, perfect sacrifice that humans cannot replicate or earn.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Lamb of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is announcing that... he is actually the conqueror
He has done what he came into the world to do

object.identificatie: The taking away of the sin of the world / Completion of the Father's work
tekstueel_bewijs: Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
It is completed; it is perfected.

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Will of Him who sent me
tekstueel_bewijs: My food is to do the will of him who sent me
These rituals were ordained by God

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Hearer (Corporal, Bishop, 'each and every one of us')
tekstueel_bewijs: That is the message for that young corporal and for the bishop and for each and every one of us.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Scripture / The Old Testament Rituals (as preparation)
tekstueel_bewijs: creating the new community that will bear his Spirit into the world

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Death / The Human Impulse to 'Earn'
tekstueel_bewijs: It is in the nature of the human being to think... we have to earn it.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'terrible curse' and an 'ugliness' that only the death of the Son of God could lift.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to achieve peace or atonement through effort or ritual.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human (Private Ryan, the Bishop, the Corporal)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a failed attempt that is superseded by the primary program (Christ's work).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/Forgiveness → The World

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus is announcing that... he is actually the conqueror
He has done what he came into the world to do
He is the true source of all fruit and life
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The young men brag among themselves

voorbeelden: we have to do more (presented as a false obligation)
They want to talk to me
to see what is completed most of all
In order to understand the full dimensions

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) of Christ in contrast to the 'Non-Pouvoir' of humanity. It is a classic Grace-oriented modal structure.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1 (Christ's cry) to ~S1 (Human attempts to earn), then to S2 (The reality of sin/guilt), and finally back to S1 (The sufficiency of the Cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Once for all' (Ephapax) nature of Christ's work, which nullifies the need for human performance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Yes, S2 is taken very seriously through the examples of the Corporal and the Bishop.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places Christ as the active Subject and humanity as the passive, needy Receiver. It explicitly deconstructs moralism (the 'Earn this' mentality).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is in the nature of the human being to think... we have to earn it.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has done what he came into the world to do.
It is finished. It is accomplished. It is enough.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon uses human figures (Private Ryan, Corporal) not as models to follow, but as examples of the human predicament and the need for grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Christ is the only figure whose action matters; humans are the ones who receive the benefit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, peace, and the removal of the burden of performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God's action is the sole cause of the new state of affairs.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly integrated; the secondary program of human effort is shown to be a 'shadow' or a 'failure' that points to the primary program of Christ.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The ugliness of his Crucifixion corresponds to the ugliness of the sin of the world.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned as being 'borne into the world' by the new community, but the focus remains on the work of the Son.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'terrible curse' that humans cannot lift themselves.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure. Christ is the Subject, Sin is the Opponent, and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance for a Good Friday/Gospel context.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to emphasize the 'Once for all' nature of the work.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already sufficiently intensified.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology is primary; ethics is not even mentioned to ensure the focus remains on the finished work.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a profound example of Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It resists the urge to give the hearer a 'to-do' list, focusing entirely on the 'done' of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetorical analysis would look at the pathos of the Corporal's story, Greimasian analysis shows that the Corporal is an actantial 'Receiver' in need of a 'Subject' (Christ).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'Tetelestai'; semiotics explains how that word functions as the 'Performance' phase of the Subject's mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Saving Private Ryan' example is not just a cultural reference, but a competing narrative program (Subject=Man) that the sermon seeks to defeat.

volledige_object_lijst: the will of him who sent me
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Desire' to show that while humans desire peace, they lack the 'Pouvoir' to achieve it, which Christ provides.
